title: Animal Welfare and Ethical Considerations in Veterinary Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Basic veterinary science concepts and biological understanding
context.additional_context: Course exploring alternative educational methods through ethical considerations of animal-based practical training and real data analysis, with learners investigating real cases and participating in simulation tool development or alternative practice model design in teams

learning_goals: Learners can classify at least three types of animals used in veterinary practice and explain the procedural types in which each animal is utilized.
Learners can present at least two criteria for evaluating the legitimacy of practical education by comparing it with animal protection ethics guidelines.
Learners can plan and propose alternative practical models (e.g., simulations, virtual reality) that minimize animal use.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
